metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11035 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When processing certain files, PHP EXIF extension in versions 7.1.x below 7.1.28, 7.2.x below 7.2.17 and 7.3.x below 7.3.4 can be caused to read past allocated buffer in exif_iif_add_value function. This may lead to information disclosure or crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11035` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
php7.0 - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.4
php7.0-bcmath - 7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.4

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.33-0ubuntu0.16.04.4').
